tn.text: These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"came to deliver Israel" or "became the leader to deliver Israel"
Here "Israel" represents the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "judged" means he led the people of Israel.
three years** - "23 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "and they buried him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: He was followed by Jair the Gileadite
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Jair the Gileadite was leader after Tola" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Jair was from the tribe of Gilead.
Here "judged" means he led the people of Israel.
Here "Israel" represents the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
two years** - "22 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"30" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This is the name of a region, which is named after a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This means to the time when the book of Judges was being written.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "they buried him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: added to the evil they had done in the sight of Yahweh
tn.text: This speaks of evil as if it were an object that a person could add to and make bigger. AT: "continued doing what Yahweh said was evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "in the sight of Yahweh" represents what Yahweh considers or thinks about something. AT: "according to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is the plural of Ashtoroth, who was worshiped as a goddess in many different forms. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:02:11|2:13]].

tn.ref: They abandoned Yahweh and no longer worshiped him
tn.text: The author basically said the same thing twice for emphasis. These can be combined.  AT: "They completely stopped worshiping Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
No longer obeying and worshiping Yahweh is spoken of as if the people left Yahweh and went somewhere else. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Yahweh burned with anger toward Israel
tn.text: Yahweh becoming angry is spoken of as if anger were a burning fire. AT: "Yahweh was very angry at Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: he sold them into the hand of the Philistines and into the hand of the Ammonites
tn.text: Yahweh allowing the Philistines and the Ammonites to defeat the Israelites is spoken of as if he sold the Israelites to them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "hand" represents power or control. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These two words basically mean the same and emphasize how much the Israelites suffered. AT: "terribly oppressed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"18 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This means on the east side of the Jordan River.
"this region is also called Gilead"
"Judah" and "Benjamin" refer to the people belonging to those tribes. AT: "the people of the tribe of Judah ... the people of the tribe of Benjamin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The "house" refers to the people of the tribe of Ephraim. AT: "the people of the tribe of Ephraim" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: so that Israel was greatly distressed
tn.text: "Israel" refers to the people of Israel. AT: "so that the people of Israel suffered much" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: the people of Israel called out to Yahweh
tn.text: This means the people of Israel desperately asked Yahweh for help.
The people no longer obeying and worshiping Yahweh is spoken of as if they left Yahweh and went somewhere else. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The people are speaking to Yahweh and refer to him as "our God." This can be stated in second person. AT: "abandoned you, our God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])

tn.ref: Did I not deliver you ... Sidonians?
tn.text: God was rebuking the people of Israel for their worship of other gods. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "I was the one who delivered you ... Sidonians." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
These are the people from the clan or family of Maon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Here "power" represents the Amalekites and the Maonites. AT: "from them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The people no longer obeying and worshiping Yahweh is spoken of as if they left Yahweh and went somewhere else. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I will not keep adding to the times I deliver you
tn.text: The phrase "keep adding to the times" is an idiom that means to continue to do something. You can make explicit the implicit meaning of Yahweh's saying. AT: "I will not keep on delivering you again and again" or "You can be sure that I will stop delivering you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
You can make explicit the implicit meaning of this statement. AT: "foreign gods whose images they possessed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Yahweh could bear Israel's misery no longer
tn.text: Here Israel refers to the people of Israel. AT: "And Yahweh did not want the people of Israel to suffer any longer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Who is the man who will begin to fight the Ammonites?
tn.text: "Who will lead our army to fight against the Ammonites?"
